dmca.title: [ABUSE] URGENT: Illegal website hosted
dmca.body:
nc

  _____  

From: Christian Clay Campbell [mailto:christian@hdpublishing.com] 
Sent: Monday, April 04, 2005 10:12 PM
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com; Laura Huff
Subject: Fwd: [Fwd: [ABUSE] URGENT: Illegal website hosted]


Dear Sir or Madam:

I am writing for the second time to demand the immediate removal of the web
site currently hosted at http://www.hothostweb.com (67.19.247.204). The web
site hosted at this address is copyrighted material, being parts of our
corporate web site hosted at http://www.affiliatesuccess.net.

My company owns the exclusive rights -- copyrights, trade and service marks
-- to the names Harris Digital Publishing, Inc., Net Detective,
Turbo-Surfer, Genealogy Detective, CleanCredit, System Supervisor, and
System Detective. We have in no way authorized the use of the these names or
marks in ANY manner by this individual. Obviously the stolen materials are
being used to represent some individual or other entity as HDP, Inc. and
this will not be tolerated.

On behalf of Harris Digital Publishing, Inc., I demand the IMMEDIATE removal
of this web site from your server(s) and/or network. This is my second
request and legal action will follow if steps are not taken on the part of
your company in a timely fashion. This web site has already been publicized
in online forums and is financially damaging to our lucrative and
long-standing software affiliate program. I have previously e-mailed and
spoken with your technical support office. In my opinion, you have had ample
time in which to deal with this issue and your continued negligence in this
matter is directly contributing to serious damage to my company.

Please attend to this matter and respond to this e-mail promptly!


Christian
--
Christian Clay Campbell
Director of Information Technology
Harris Digital Publishing, Inc.

"A question settled by violence, or in disregard of law, must remain
unsettled forever." -- Jefferson Davis

Begin forwarded message:



From: The Planet Policy Enforcement <abuse@theplanet.com>

address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

Please also be advised that the Point of Contact for The Planet Policy
Enforcement is abuse@theplanet.com


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] URGENT: Illegal website hosted
Date: Mon, 4 Apr 2005 17:13:19 -0400 (EDT)
From: christian@hdpublishing.com
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Hello,

I have attempted to speak directly with _anyone_ in the abuse department
at the number listed in Arin's output for the following IP address
67.19.247.204, which is given for the web site
http://www.hothostweb.com. My company, Cyberspace To Paradise, Inc.,
d.b.a. Harris Digital Publishing, Inc. owns all trademarks and service
marks related to Net Detective and Harris Digital Publishing. Someone has
stolen our corporate website material and is hosting it at 67.19.247.204.

I was told by "Mike Vu", "team leader" of the technical support department
who answered the phone at the abuse number listed in your Arin output that
I could not and would not be transfered to the appropriate abuse
department and that I MUST email this information as it was too "petty" to
disturb his manager. According to Arin's policy there must be "accurate
upstream Abuse and Technical POCs visible on the WHOIS record for that
block."

I must have this person shut down immediately as this site is stealing
money and resources from our company. Please refer to the Arin output
below.

Sincerely,
Christian Clay Campbell
Director of Information Technology
Harris Digital Publishing, Inc.
